meanings.definition: A person who arrives after the expected or usual time.
meanings.sent1: The latecomers missed the beginning of the movie.
meanings.sent2: The teacher waited patiently for the latecomers to join the class.
meanings.sent3: The latecomers rushed in, out of breath, apologizing for their tardiness.
meanings.sent4: The latecomers were like shadows, appearing when least expected.
meanings.sent5: The latecomers were always the last to arrive, making a grand entrance.

meanings.definition: Those who come late to a particular event or gathering.
meanings.sent1: The latecomers at the party missed the surprise cake cutting.
meanings.sent2: The concert was already in full swing when the latecomers arrived.
meanings.sent3: The latecomers showed up fashionably late, causing a stir among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The latecomers were like unexpected guests, adding excitement to the gathering.
meanings.sent5: The latecomers brought a burst of energy to the event, catching everyone's attention.
